intro: Urostigma concinnum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Urostigma concinnum is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
